turns.content: Hi Grandpa, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? It's urgent we talk about something important regarding your Social Security benefits.

I'm sorry, but I think there might be a mistake. Can I please speak with someone at the real Social Security office to confirm who I should be speaking with today? Could you provide me with their number instead of giving out any personal information? Thank you for understanding.

Of course Grandpa, but listen carefully because this is very important. Your social security number has been compromised and unless we take action immediately, your benefits will be suspended starting tomorrow morning. I'm here to help prevent that from happening. We need to verify your identity right now so we can secure your account. Do you have a pen and paper handy?
Hold on just a moment, let me talk to my wife first before we proceed with anything sensitive like this. Please hold the line while I do that, okay?
Absolutely Grandpa, take your time but please come back as soon as you can. This really is urgent and we need to act fast to protect your benefits. We'll wait right here for you.

Wife, someone claiming to be from Social Security says my account might be compromised and they want to verify some personal information over the phone. What should I do? Should I call them back at the official number or is it better if I hang up now?
They say this needs immediate action but I'm not sure we should give out any info until we're absolutely certain who they are.
